result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darius Latrail Wade

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $5000.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list. 24 hour curfew. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Darius Latrail Wade in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Defendant Darius Latrail Wade in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Darius Latrail Wade appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count(s) 2 and 3. AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3 COURT DISMISSES "DOMESTIC ABUSE REPEATER" ENHANCER. This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
